intro: Chelyella serrulata, commonly known as the serrated chelyella, is a species of flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely serrated leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded woodland areas. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
